remarks: The inverse of the inverse of an isomorphism is itself.  Proposition 3.14(1) of [Adamek] p. 29.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Jan-2017.)
statement:
invfval.b $e |- B = ( Base ` C ) $.
invfval.n $e |- N = ( Inv ` C ) $.
invfval.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. Cat ) $.
invfval.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. B ) $.
invfval.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. B ) $.
isoval.n $e |- I = ( Iso ` C ) $.
invinv.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( X I Y ) ) $.
invinv $p |- ( ph -> ( ( Y N X ) ` ( ( X N Y ) ` F ) ) = F ) $.
